intro: Tradescantia pulchella, commonly known as the pink wandering jew, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a low-growing perennial that features striking pink to purple flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. It is often used in garden landscapes for its ornamental value and easy care requirements. Its ability to spread via rhizomes makes it both a desirable and sometimes invasive plant in certain regions.
